title: List of current champions in WWE
text:
<a href="WWE">WWE</a> is an American <a href="professional%20wrestling">professional wrestling</a> <a href="Professional%20wrestling%20promotion">promotion</a> based out of <a href="Stamford%2C%20Connecticut">Stamford</a>, <a href="Connecticut">Connecticut</a> and is the world's largest promotion. The company promotes several <a href="Professional%20wrestling%20championship">championships</a> and title reigns are either determined by <a href="Professional%20wrestling%20match%20types">professional wrestling matches</a> or are awarded to a wrestler, as a result of the culmination of various scripted <a href="Kayfabe">storylines</a>.
WWE divides its roster between four <a href="WWE%20brand%20extension">brands</a>, which is where wrestlers exclusively compete on a weekly basis, albeit with some exceptions. The two primary brands that WWE promotes are <a href="Raw%20%28WWE%20brand%29">Raw</a> and <a href="SmackDown%20%28WWE%20brand%29">SmackDown</a>. <a href="NXT%20%28WWE%20brand%29">NXT</a> serves as the <a href="farm%20team">developmental brand</a> for the main roster (though was considered a main brand from 2019 to 2021), and <a href="NXT%20UK%20%28WWE%20brand%29">NXT UK</a> is for wrestlers based in the <a href="United%20Kingdom">United Kingdom</a> and is considered a subdivision of NXT.
All four brands have a primary and secondary championship for male wrestlers, a singles championship for female wrestlers, and a tag team championship for male wrestlers. There are two tag team championships for female wrestlers—one shared by Raw and SmackDown, and the other on NXT. There is also a tertiary championship, which is open to anyone, regardless of gender or WWE employment status.
There are currently 19 championships in WWE. As of , , among the four current brands, 25 wrestlers officially hold championships. This list includes the number of times the wrestler has held the title, the date and location of the win, and a description of the winning bout.
Overview.
Men.
At the top of <a href="WWE">WWE</a>'s championship hierarchy for male wrestlers are the <a href="WWE%20Championship">WWE Championship</a> on <a href="Raw%20%28WWE%20brand%29">Raw</a>, the <a href="WWE%20Universal%20Championship">Universal Championship</a> on <a href="SmackDown%20%28WWE%20brand%29">SmackDown</a>, and the <a href="NXT%20Championship">NXT Championship</a> on <a href="NXT%20%28WWE%20brand%29">NXT</a> — all regarded as <a href="Professional%20wrestling%20championship%23World%20championships">world championships</a>. The WWE Championship is held by two-time champion <a href="Bobby%20Lashley">Bobby Lashley</a>, who defeated <a href="Brock%20Lesnar">Brock Lesnar</a> at the <a href="Royal%20Rumble%20%282022%29">Royal Rumble</a> on January 29, 2022. The Universal Championship is held by <a href="Roman%20Reigns">Roman Reigns</a>, who is in his second reign. He won the title by defeating previous champion <a href="Bray%20Wyatt">"The Fiend" Bray Wyatt</a> and <a href="Braun%20Strowman">Braun Strowman</a>, who Reigns pinned, in a <a href="Professional%20wrestling%20match%20types%23Basic%20non-elimination%20matches">No Holds Barred</a> <a href="Triple%20Threat%20match">Triple Threat match</a> at <a href="Payback%20%282020%29">Payback</a> on August 30, 2020. The NXT Championship is held by first-time champion <a href="Bron%20Breakker">Bron Breakker</a>, who won the title by defeating <a href="Tommaso%20Ciampa">Tommaso Ciampa</a> on January 4, 2022, at .
<a href="Professional%20wrestling%20championship%23Location-specific%20championships">Secondary titles</a> for male wrestlers include the <a href="WWE%20United%20States%20Championship">United States Championship</a> on Raw, the <a href="WWE%20Intercontinental%20Championship">Intercontinental Championship</a> on SmackDown, and the <a href="NXT%20North%20American%20Championship">North American Championship</a> on NXT. The United States Championship is held by <a href="Damian%20Priest">Damian Priest</a>, who is in his first reign. He defeated <a href="Sheamus">Sheamus</a> on August 21, 2021, at <a href="SummerSlam%20%282021%29">SummerSlam</a>. The Intercontinental Championship is held by two-time champion <a href="Shinsuke%20Nakamura">Shinsuke Nakamura</a>, who defeated <a href="Apollo%20Crews">Apollo Crews</a> on the August 13, 2021, episode of "<a href="WWE%20SmackDown">SmackDown</a>". He won the title under the ring name "King Nakamura", but relinquished the crown on October 8, 2021, out of respect for the <a href="King%20of%20the%20Ring%20%282021%29">2021 King of the Ring tournament</a>. The North American Championship is held by first-time champion <a href="Carmelo%20Hayes">Carmelo Hayes</a>, who defeated <a href="Isaiah%20%26quot%3BSwerve%26quot%3B%20Scott">Isaiah "Swerve" Scott</a> on the October 12, 2021, episode of "<a href="WWE%20NXT">NXT 2.0</a>" by cashing in his <a href="NXT%20Breakout%20Tournament%20%282021%29">NXT Breakout Tournament contract</a> on Swerve, who had just retained the title in a match against <a href="Santos%20Escobar">Santos Escobar</a>.
Women.
At the top of WWE's championship hierarchy for female wrestlers are the <a href="WWE%20Raw%20Women%27s%20Championship">Raw Women's Championship</a>, the <a href="WWE%20SmackDown%20Women%27s%20Championship">SmackDown Women's Championship</a>, and the <a href="NXT%20Women%27s%20Championship">NXT Women's Championship</a> — all regarded as <a href="Professional%20wrestling%20championship%23World%20championships">world championships</a>. The Raw Women's Championship is held by two-time champion <a href="Becky%20Lynch">Becky Lynch</a>, while the SmackDown Women's Championship is held by record six-time champion <a href="Charlotte%20Flair">Charlotte Flair</a>. Prior to the <a href="2021%20WWE%20Draft">2021 WWE Draft</a>, Lynch and Flair held the opposite titles and during the draft, the two women were drafted to the opposing brands. On the October 22, 2021, episode of "<a href="WWE%20SmackDown">SmackDown</a>", the night draft results went into effect, WWE official <a href="Sonya%20Deville">Sonya Deville</a> had Lynch and Flair exchange titles to keep the championships on their respective brands. The NXT Women's Championship is held by <a href="Mandy%20Rose">Mandy Rose</a>, who is in her first reign. She won the title by defeating <a href="Raquel%20Gonz%C3%A1lez%20%28wrestler%29">Raquel González</a> in a <a href="Chucky%20%28character%29">Chucky</a>'s choice <a href="Street%20Fight%20match">Trick or Street Fight match</a> on October 26, 2021, at .
Tag team.
Men.
Raw, SmackDown, and NXT each have a <a href="World%20tag%20team%20championship">tag team championship</a> for male wrestlers. The <a href="Raw%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">Raw Tag Team Championship</a> is held by Alpha Academy (<a href="Chad%20Gable">Chad Gable</a> and <a href="Otis%20%28wrestler%29">Otis</a>), who are in their first reign as a tag team and second for Gable individually. They won the titles by defeating <a href="RK-Bro">RK-Bro</a> (<a href="Matt%20Riddle">Riddle</a> and <a href="Randy%20Orton">Randy Orton</a>) on the January 10, 2022, episode of "<a href="WWE%20Raw">Raw</a>". The <a href="SmackDown%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">SmackDown Tag Team Championship</a> is held by <a href="The%20Usos">The Usos</a> (<a href="Jey%20Uso">Jey Uso</a> and <a href="Jimmy%20Uso">Jimmy Uso</a>), who are in their fifth reign. They defeated <a href="Rey%20Mysterio">Rey Mysterio</a> and <a href="Dominik%20Mysterio">Dominik Mysterio</a> on July 18, 2021, during the <a href="Money%20in%20the%20Bank%20%282021%29">Money in the Bank</a> Kickoff pre-show. The <a href="NXT%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">NXT Tag Team Championship</a> is held by two-time champions <a href="Imperium%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">Imperium</a> (<a href="Fabian%20Aichner">Fabian Aichner</a> and <a href="Marcel%20Barthel">Marcel Barthel</a>), who defeated <a href="MSK%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">MSK</a> (<a href="Nash%20Carter">Nash Carter</a> and <a href="Wes%20Lee">Wes Lee</a>) in a <a href="Professional%20wrestling%20match%20types%23Lumberjack">Lumber Jack-o-Lantern match</a> on October 26, 2021, at .
Women.
There are two tag team championships for female wrestlers — the <a href="WWE%20Women%27s%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">WWE Women's Tag Team Championship</a>, which is shared by Raw and SmackDown, and the <a href="NXT%20Women%27s%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">NXT Women's Tag Team Championship</a>, which is defended on NXT. The WWE Women's Tag Team Championship is held by <a href="Carmella%20%28wrestler%29">Carmella</a> and <a href="Queen%20Zelina">Queen Zelina</a>, who are in their first reign as a team. They defeated <a href="Nikki%20A.S.H.">Nikki A.S.H.</a> and <a href="Rhea%20Ripley">Rhea Ripley</a> on the November 22, 2021, episode of "<a href="WWE%20Raw">Raw</a>". The NXT Women's Tag Team Championship is held by first-time champions <a href="Toxic%20Attraction">Toxic Attraction</a> (<a href="Priscilla%20Kelly">Gigi Dolin</a> and <a href="Jacy%20Jayne">Jacy Jayne</a>). They defeated previous champions <a href="Io%20Shirai">Io Shirai</a> and <a href="Zoey%20Stark">Zoey Stark</a> and the team of <a href="Indi%20Hartwell">Indi Hartwell</a> and <a href="Persia%20Pirotta">Persia Pirotta</a> in a <a href="Ladder%20match">Three-way Scareway to Hell Ladder match</a> on October 26, 2021, at .
UK.
The top title for male wrestlers in <a href="NXT%20UK%20%28WWE%20brand%29">NXT UK</a> is the <a href="NXT%20United%20Kingdom%20Championship">NXT United Kingdom Championship</a>. It is held by <a href="Ilja%20Dragunov">Ilja Dragunov</a>, who is in his first reign. He won the title by defeating <a href="Walter%20%28wrestler%29">Walter</a> at <a href="NXT%20TakeOver%2036">NXT TakeOver 36</a> on August 22, 2021. The top title for female wrestlers is the <a href="NXT%20UK%20Women%27s%20Championship">NXT UK Women's Championship</a>. It is held by first-time title holder <a href="Meiko%20Satomura">Meiko Satomura</a>, who won the title by defeating <a href="Kay%20Lee%20Ray">Kay Lee Ray</a> on the June 10, 2021, episode of "<a href="NXT%20UK">NXT UK</a>" (the actual date the match took place is unknown). The secondary championship for male wrestlers is the <a href="NXT%20UK%20Heritage%20Cup">NXT UK Heritage Cup</a>, which has a special stipulation in which all matches are contested under "<a href="NXT%20UK%20Heritage%20Cup%20Championship%23British%20Rounds%20Rules">British Rounds Rules</a>". It is held by <a href="Noam%20Dar">Noam Dar</a>, who is in his first reign. He defeated <a href="Tyler%20Bate">Tyler Bate</a> on the October 28, 2021, episode of "<a href="NXT%20UK">NXT UK</a>" (the actual date the match took place is unknown). There is only one tag team championship in NXT UK, and it is for male wrestlers. The <a href="NXT%20UK%20Tag%20Team%20Championship">NXT UK Tag Team Championship</a> is held by <a href="Moustache%20Mountain">Moustache Mountain</a> (<a href="Trent%20Seven">Trent Seven</a> and <a href="Tyler%20Bate">Tyler Bate</a>), who are in their first reign. They defeated <a href="Pretty%20Deadly%20%28professional%20wrestling%29">Pretty Deadly</a> (Lewis Howley and Sam Stoker) on the December 9, 2021, episode of "<a href="NXT%20UK">NXT UK</a>" (the actual date the match took place is unknown).
Tertiary.
The <a href="WWE%2024/7%20Championship">WWE 24/7 Championship</a> is a tertiary championship shared across all five brands and is open to anyone regardless of gender (including non-WWE personnel). It can be defended anytime, <a href="Falls%20Count%20Anywhere%20match">anywhere</a>, as long as a WWE referee is present. The title is held by <a href="Dana%20Brooke">Dana Brooke</a> from Raw, who is in her first reign. She pinned <a href="Cedric%20Alexander">Cedric Alexander</a> on the November 22, 2021, episode of "<a href="WWE%20Raw">Raw</a>".
Current champions.
Tables with a "Days recognized" column means that WWE officially recognizes a different number of days that a wrestler has held a title due to an event airing on <a href="Broadcast%20delay">tape delay</a>. In some cases, particularly recent NXT UK events, the actual date an event took place is unknown.
Shared championships.
The colors indicate the home brand of the champions.
